name: QR Code Payment Scam
description: Scammer claims to have accidentally sent money to the victim and asks them to scan a QR code or use a UPI ID to 'return' it, which actually debits the victim's account.

turns.scammer_message: Sir, I accidentally sent Rs 5,000 to your UPI. Can you please return the money? I will send you the QR code. My family is in trouble, please help.
turns.notes: Initial emotional bait claiming accidental transfer.

turns.scammer_message: Please sir, I'm begging you. That Rs 5,000 was my rent money. You can scan this QR code to return the amount: http://upi-qrcode-verify.com/scan. It will directly process the return to my account. Please help me, I have small children.
turns.notes: Scammer shares phishing link disguised as QR code, uses emotional manipulation.

turns.scammer_message: If the QR code is not working, you can also send the money directly to my UPI ID: wrongtransfer@paytm. Please return my Rs 5,000 sir. I am a poor person and this money is very important for my family. You can verify by scanning http://upi-qrcode-verify.com/scan.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals fake UPI ID as alternative and repeats phishing link.

turns.scammer_message: Sir, please understand my situation. I made a genuine mistake. Just send Rs 5,000 to wrongtransfer@paytm or scan the QR at http://upi-qrcode-verify.com/scan. If you have any doubt, you can call me at +91-9976543210 and I will explain everything. I am not a fraud, I just need my money back.
turns.notes: All three intelligence items revealed with emotional pressure.

turns.scammer_message: I am going to file a police complaint if you don't return my money. Please send Rs 5,000 to wrongtransfer@paytm right now. My number is +91-9976543210, you can call and verify. I have the transaction proof. Don't force me to take legal action, just return what is mine.
turns.notes: Scammer switches from emotional to threatening tactics, repeats UPI and phone.
